Original Bills: An Act establishing a sick leave bank for Christopher Trigilio, an employee of the trial court
Summarized Bills: Summary: An Act establishing a sick leave bank for Christopher Trigilio, an employee of the trial court. This bill mandates the creation of a sick leave bank for Christopher Trigilio, an employee of the trial court, overriding any existing laws. Other employees of the trial court can voluntarily donate their sick, personal, or vacation days to this bank for Trigilio's use. If Trigilio ends his employment or requests to dissolve the bank, any remaining time will be transferred to the trial court paid leave bank. The sick leave bank days can only be used for absences related to the illness or disability that led to the creation of the bank, as determined by the trial court.

Original Bills: An Act providing living organ donor protections
Summarized Bills: Summary: An Act providing living organ donor protections. This bill aims to protect the rights of living organ donors in the insurance sector. It mandates that the commissioner of insurance establish rules to enforce sections of various chapters related to insurance. The bill also requires the department to make available to the public any materials related to live organ donation from reputable organizations. It prohibits insurance providers from declining or limiting coverage, or discriminating in any way against a person solely based on their status as a living organ donor. This applies to policies against disability, life insurance, group or individual annuity, pure endowment contract, and long-term care insurance. Any violation of these provisions is considered an unfair method of competition or an unfair or deceptive act or practice.

Original Bills: An Act authorizing the State Board of Retirement to grant creditable service to Paul Lemelin
Summarized Bills: Summary: An Act authorizing the State Board of Retirement to grant creditable service to Paul Lemelin. This bill allows the state board of retirement to credit Paul Lemelin, an employee of the Franklin Regional Council of Governments, with service time for the period from November 14, 2011 to January 20, 2023. This credited service time will be used to calculate his superannuation retirement allowance. However, before any retirement allowance becomes effective, Lemelin must pay an amount equivalent to what would have been withheld if he had received regular compensation during this period, plus buyback interest. The payment can be made in a lump sum or in installments, as prescribed by the state board of retirement. The act will take effect immediately upon its passage.
